In #Angola, "the Bank has focused on accelerating economic diversification + reducing the dependence from oil through integrated investments in agricultural transformation + promotion of industrialization towards sustainable job creation + poverty reduction..." - Ottoniel Santos

"AfDB resumed its operations in #Angola in 2001 after the civil war. Since then, the Bank has collaborated with us and provided diversified support to development efforts in various sectors of the economy, such as agriculture, energy, transport.." - Ottoniel Santos

"The launch of SEGA is a new milestone that will contribute to promoting public sector effectiveness, thus stimulating structural transformation throughout the continent..." - Ottoniel Santos, Secretary of State for Treasure and Finance, Angola

"...we have developed a long-standing tradition in upholding the values of transparency, openness, inclusion + equity, which we will now seek to help institutionalize in our regional member countries at the regional, national + subnational levels." - Swazi Tshabalala, Acting SVP

"SEGA has been prepared in the spirit of fostering better policies, enhancing regulatory settings + improved institutions that African countries can adopt in the running of their respective economies to foster #inclusivegrowth + enhance the business climate." - Swazi Tshabalala

"SEGA also takes on the subject of the sustainable performance of state-owned enterprises...This is especially more so as we drive toward greater Public Private Partnership models to help us bridge the gap in financing the continent‚Äôs development." - Swazi Tshabalala, Acting SVP

"SEGA will serve as blueprint for the Bank‚Äôs future engagements not only on the subject of debt management + transparency but also broader public financial management, anti-corruption, curbing illicit financial flows + general accountability in the public sector." - @Duchess6401

"... as African economies recover from the eco ramifications of #Covid19, countries are faced with difficult trade-offs, ie. the pressure to pursue expansionary fiscal policies to boost growth, balanced with the need to maintain low + sustainable levels of debt." - @Duchess6401

"Reform processes themselves are incredibly challenging to drive. They need to be timely, desirable, and feasible and it can be difficult to achieve them simultaneously." - Swazi Tshabalala, Acting SVP, African Development Bank

"The launch of the SEGA coincides with the broad and emerging consensus on the need for wider governance reforms as was widely discussed at the Annual Meetings #AfDBAM2021..." - Swazi Tshabalala, Acting SVP, African Development Bank (@Duchess6401)

#DasguptaReview: The economics of the #biosphere is an asset management problem. the idea is to include a class of assets that has been thoroughly neglected in economic thinking and practice - business practice, government practice...  - Professor Partha Dasgupta

#DasguptaReview: We have to move away from the notion of a single metric, like carbon, and not talk in terms of that, but instead talk in terms of the assets which comprise the #biosphere. - Professor Partha Dasgupta

#DasguptaReview: It sets very clear boundary conditions that the #biosphere is not something that you can continue to extract from, but you have to put something back... - African Development Bank President @akin_adesina

#DasguptaReview: It challenges assumptions that we've made about the #biosphere. It challenges us about how we deal with natural resources and how we account for natural resources and #biodiversity in all of what we do. - African Development Bank President @akin_adesina

Joint Declaration of African Public Development Banks:  "We call on heads of state and international organizations to support our role in the African financial system and to provide us with the necessary means and incentives."  More:  https://t.co/6XcBvqZi1S #FiCSystem

"It is very important that the Youth Entrepreneurship Investment Banks be very conversant with digital banking.... eg. neobanks have started to emerge in Africa and we should encourage many more of them..." - Jean-Philippe Prosper, Independent Director, former VP for Africa, IFC

"Not only speed in terms of the initiative, but speed in terms of decision making at the level of the deployers of capital. I have seen many SMEs ask for money that they need in 6 months before they run out of money and they don't get a decision for 2 years." - Ladi Balogun

"We do have a ticking time bomb on our hands. These numbers that we have to hit on an annual basis in terms of job creation - every year we miss it makes the problem even more acute - so we have to ask ourselves how we can move very fast on this." Ladi Balogun, CEO of @MyFCMB

"Being youth-led means that the African Development Bank actually puts the voice of youth and the different needs of youth at the centre." - @YanaKakar, Global Managing Partner Emeritus, @DalbergTweet

"The thing that strikes me as most important and differentiating about this [Youth Entrepreneurship Investment Banks] initiative is the degree to which it is youth-centric in a way that we haven't seen before." - @YanaKakar, Global Managing Partner Emeritus, @DalbergTweet

"The Youth Entrepreneurship Investment Banks is something that we are going to see as reality very soon, we just need to piece all the pieces together and align that passion and focus that we all have." - @AshishJThakkar

How do we create a scalable and self-sustainable solution? There is no one better, with authentic passion and vision for the youth across Africa than @akin_adesina and the team at @AfDB_Group..." - @AshishJThakkar

"‚ÄãAccess to finance and access to capital is the biggest hindrance. There's no lack of amazing ideas and innovation across the continent, particularly amongst the youth." - @AshishJThakkar, President of @MaraGrp and current Chair of @AfDB_Group Presidential Youth Committee

"... the needs of entrepreneurs are varied. One cannot provide the same type of support to each and every entrepreneur. At the same time, the situations in countries are varied.... we have to establish an ecosystem that will provide holistic support..." - @Severino_JM

"...if you don't care about the way players are going to be recruited, trained, what type of competition they can access, nothing will happen just by building stadiums and waiting for the players to show up. We won't achieve anything." - @Severino_JM [2/2]

"The way we have been operating can be compared to the way people would like to promote football (soccer) by building stadiums. And of course, at some stage, you have to have stadiums if you want to promote football, but..." - @Severino_JM, CEO of @ietp_   [1/2]

"We have dedicated $50million a year over the last 3 years to support entrepreneurs... giving them seed money and also providing technical assistance." - @Psarr_der, Minister, General Delegate for Women and Youth Entrepreneurship, Presidency of the Republic of Senegal

"We look forward to seeing what the Youth Entrepreneurship Investment Banks will be able to do... For us it's just not about the money we get, it's about the life that the youth can be able to impact when they receive the investments." - Yvonne Otieno, CEO of @MiyongaFresh

"We enrolled in a business incubation programme and in just six months from 1,5 acres we grew to 10 acres of land... now we were just not farmers but exporting to Europe. This is where capacity building comes in..." - Yvonne Otieno, CEO of @MiyongaFresh

Yvonne Otieno, CEO of @MiyongaFresh shares some thoughts on her entrepreneurial journey: We came across different challenges as a business... the support we got from different partners were extremely useful to us. Is it still a challenge for us to get financing right now? Yes.

"Young people face institutional and structural barriers in accessing the financial system... Spain welcomes @AfDB_Group Youth Entrepreneurship Investment initiative, geared towards unlocking entrepreneurship & promoting the growth of businesses of the youth." - @AranchaGlezLaya

"Youth is an engine for sustainable growth and key for socio-economic stability. There is often talk of Africa's demographic dividend but it will only come about if the youth are gainfully employed." - @AranchaGlezLaya, Minister of Foreign Affairs, EU and Cooperation, Spain

"It is time to create new financial ecosystems that are able to support the businesses of the youth, grow them, and unlock the latent demand of financing by millions of youth. This will help us turn Africa's demographic asset into an economic asset..." - @akin_adesina

"The challenge the youth face is that they lack the finance to turn their ideas into viable businesses... Africa must move beyond youth empowerment to youth investment. It is time to put the capital of Africa at risk on behalf of the youth." - @akin_adesina
"We must support the youth to go beyond looking for jobs. We must unleash the entrepreneurial drive and capacities of the youth to create jobs." - African Development Bank President @akin_adesina

To integrate financial markets, the Bank created the first publicly traded regional index bond fund in Africa. It follows 8 African bond markets, representing 75% of the most liquid bonds of the continent, with a market capitalization of over $180 billion. #AfDBAM2019

Soft infrastructure is just as important to #IntegrateAfrica, as different rules & regulations significantly increase trading costs for companies across Africa. The Bank has invested $20 million over the past 5 years to facilitate intra-African trade. #AfDBAM2019
#DidYouKnow The Bank is one of the continent‚Äôs leading financiers in infrastructure, ranking first in transport and second in energy and water. #AfDBAM2019
